attributes.action: put his money where his mouth is.  The Prime Minister should lodge in the Bank of England a bond of, say, one million pounds sterling of his own money.  Said money to be redeemable in ten years only if by that time no-one has been succesfully prosecuted for having forged an ID card and  matching biometric record.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
According to the email response to the "scrap the proposed introduction of ID cards" e-petition, the Prime Minister admits that "There is no doubt that building yourself a new and false identity is all too easy at the moment. Forging an ID card and matching biometric record will be much harder." 

If it's only much harder and not impossible, then it isn't worth the cost  and effort of doing it.  Once forged IDs are available to criminals and terrorists, there is absolutely no benefit to having them at all.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
